drive.label: Drive
drive.value: To crown himself Halcyon City’s eternal headliner by weaponizing adoration, editing memory through music, and rewriting the city’s rhythm so every beat bows to The King.

abilities.label: Abilities
abilities.value:
• Sonic sovereignty (hypnotic croon, knee-quaking rhythm, command audiences)
  • Graceland glamour (rhinestone illusions; cape-swirl misdirection; shimmering hard-light stagecraft)
  • Hound-dog drones (holographic/sonic canids that herd crowds and harry heroes)
  • Blue suede kinetics (stomp-shockwaves; ricochet footwork)
  • Memetic hooks (earworms that twist Labels and Influence)

biography.label: Notes
biography.value: Play up crowds, cameras, and charisma. He doesn’t just fight—he performs: spotlights, cape flicks, screaming fans. Lean on Put Innocents in Danger via stampedes and swoons; use his songs to Take Influence and Tell Them Who They Are. When The King marks conditions, the stage gets bigger—new hazards, louder choruses, brighter glare. Give the team dramatic choices between saving the audience, rejecting his narrative, and pressing the advantage.

items.name: Tell Them Who They Are or Should Be

system.description: @UUID[Compendium.masks-newgeneration-unofficial.documents.llXD7GIZiU5z5MiG.JournalEntryPage.vbmelu6amDCsv8Xp]{Tell Them Who They Are or Who They Should Be}
@UUID[Compendium.masks-newgeneration-unofficial.documents.llXD7GIZiU5z5MiG.JournalEntryPage.WDtPMAeq3CIumtrg]{Bring an NPC to Rash Decisions and Hard Conclusions}

He snaps his cape; a prismatic ripple reflects threat and doubt. The next attempt to directly engage him is under pressure—shift the result down by 1 or the attacker marks Afraid to push through. If they hesitate, he repositions behind the nearest cover or crowd and puts innocents in danger with the ricochet.

A furious whistle unleashes a pack of sonic hounds and a heel-stomp quake. –1 Team from the chaos. Target the loudest mask: they choose—mark a condition to stand up to the wall of sound, or give ground as The King isolates someone behind a wall of baying hounds.

His voice softens; he offers a trembling hand and a tender verse. Choose one: heal a bystander (stabilize and clear their peril) or offer a hero a heartfelt apology. If the hero accepts, clear 1 condition and The King takes Influence over them; if they refuse, he marks a new condition from the rejection and turns cold.

A neon motel sign flickers into being; the air fills with sorrow. Mark a looming exit countdown: unless a hero Directly Engages or otherwise interrupts within 2 turns, The King exits the scene through the door marked “Backstage.” If stopped, he stays but marks a condition. While the sign shines, any hero who hesitates marks Hopeless.

He swirls his cape and a glittering hard-light Fortress rises. Until it’s cracked, redirect hits against him to the Fortress. A hero can Focus Fire (give ground) to shatter it now, or pick it apart over time—meanwhile he summons hound-dog drones or repositions through mirrored panels.

He hammers a pounding rhythm; bars of hard light slam down, turning the scene into a dance-yard. Separate a hero behind glowing “cells.” They can mark a condition to bust out now, or stay penned while The King completes a setup off‑panel (advance a plan, move an asset, or corner a civilian).

A heel-stomp detonates a cobalt shockwave. Shred cover, scatter the team, and knock an asset loose (a weapon, gadget, or leverage). Use it to put bystanders in danger as neon dust rains and signage teeters.

He croons doubts that stick like glitter. Target 1 hero: The King takes Influence unless they publicly affirm who they are (tell the crowd a vulnerable truth) or mark Guilty to wrestle free. If he gains Influence, he immediately shifts their Labels toward how his song frames them.

A baying harmony erupts; spectral hounds surge through aisles and rooftops. Take away a hero’s mobility or pin their cape/gear in place. If the team doesn’t split attention to rescue imperiled bystanders this round, someone marks Afraid from the snarling chaos.

Flaming neon hearts orbit and ignite hazards (drapes, signage, fuel lines). Create 2–3 danger zones and put innocents in danger. If no one works the crowd or douses flames by next round, inflict a condition on two heroes from the heat and blame.

He whips the audience into a glittering frenzy—confetti cannons, chant, stampede. Spawn a crowd hazard that overshadows quieter heroes; if no one wrangles the crowd, the team loses 1 Team and someone marks Insecure from the headlines and jeers.

A rhinestone haze settles; everything looks like it’s part of his show. While the glamour persists, The King has +1 ongoing to confuse, redirect, or evade. To break it, a hero must Reject his Influence or comfort the crowd on-screen; on a miss, mark a condition as the narrative devours you.

He needles a hero with a velvet-razor putdown broadcast over the PA. Tell them who they are: if they accept, shift their Labels as he says and The King takes Influence; if they refuse, they must Reject on-screen or mark Angry from the sting. Either way, the crowd judges—expect fallout.
